block.p: Amy Katharine Healy, a daughter of Katharine and Thomas Healy of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday to Ralph Adam Bahna, a son of Dorothy Bahna and Ralph M. Bahna of Stamford, Conn. The Rev. William J. Kennedy performed the ceremony at St. Michael the Archangel Roman Catholic Church.

Mrs. Bahna, 29, teaches preschool at the Putnam Indian Field School in Greenwich. She graduated from Fordham University. Her father works in White Plains as the manager of bank relations in the finance department of Texaco.

Amy Katharine Healy, a daughter of Katharine and Thomas Healy of Greenwich, Conn., was married there yesterday to Ralph Adam Bahna, a son of Dorothy Bahna and Ralph M. Bahna of Stamford, Conn. The Rev. William J. Kennedy performed the ceremony at St. Michael the Archangel Roman Catholic Church.

Mrs. Bahna, 29, teaches preschool at the Putnam Indian Field School in Greenwich. She graduated from Fordham University. Her father works in White Plains as the manager of bank relations in the finance department of Texaco.

Mr. Bahna, 28, is known as Adam. He coordinates initial public stock offerings for the online division of Goldman, Sachs & Company in New York. He graduated from the University of Michigan. His father, who retired as the chief executive of the Cunard Line, is the founder and chairman of Club Quarters, a hotel group in New York.
In the fall of 1994, the bride attended a Dale Carnegie course in Stamford, Conn., which her parents promised would be ''a life-changing experience.'' She met Mr. Bahna there.
